pr_title: [WFCORE-4973] Increasing LongOutputTestCase timeout from 10 to 20 seconds

timeline.bodyText:
100 seconds is 1 order of magnitude more. It seems a lot.
Would doubling to 20s be enough?
Or could we instead use org.jboss.as.test.shared.TimeoutUtil#adjust to adjust the time of this test?
timeline.author: jmesnil

replies.bodyText:
This problem pops up if I'm running whole WildFly test suite only (~ 2.5 hours).
If I run the test standalone, it always passes for me.
You are right @jmesnil 100 seconds is much more higher but
test usually doesn't spend so much time in it. It is just safer upper bound.
If you still prefer 20 seconds instead, please let me know - I will change it and will test it locally.
replies.author: ropalka

replies.bodyText: @ropalka Let's double it and use org.jboss.as.test.shared.TimeoutUtil#adjust to adjust it automatically when it is run in our CI, thanks
replies.author: jmesnil
